CatDescriptText: Charles (Chic) Jones, bartender, Henry's Tavern, 2214 Centre Avenue, was part of the Pittsburgher's Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 5, 1959 with question: "Do you believe Allegheny County Democrats and Republicans have selected their best candidates for public offices in past 10 years?"  Answer reads: "No, they haven't.  Candidates in both parties are picked by a machine Downtown.  If it wasn't that way,  the Fifth Ward would be a better ward."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charles "Chic" Jones wearing plaid short sleeved shirt, standing in front of stone building, possibly Centre Avenue, Hill District
